blocks.name: getCharacters
blocks.description: Fetches lists of comic characters with optional filters.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: name
args.info: Return only characters matching the specified full character name (e.g. Spider-Man).

args.name: nameStartsWith
args.info: Return characters with names that begin with the specified string (e.g. Sp).

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only characters which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only characters which appear in the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: series
args.info: Return only characters which appear the specified series (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: events
args.info: Return only characters which appear the specified events (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: stories
args.info: Return only characters which appear the specified stories (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: name, modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

blocks.name: getSingleCharacter
blocks.description: This method fetches a single character resource. It is the canonical URI for any character resource provided by the API.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: characterId
args.info: A single character id.

blocks.name: getComicsByCharacter
blocks.description: Fetches lists of comics containing a specific character, with optional filters.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: characterId
args.info: A single character id.

args.name: format
args.info: Filter by the issue format (e.g. comic, digital comic, hardcover, magazine, trade paperback, digest, graphic novel, infinite comic).

args.name: formatType
args.info: Filter by the issue format type (comic or collection).

args.name: noVariants
args.info: Exclude variant comics from the result set.

args.name: dateDescriptor
args.info: Return comics within a predefined date range. Values: lastWeek, thisWeek, nextWeek, thisMonth

args.name: dateRange
args.info: Return comics within a predefined date range. Dates must be specified as array.  Dates are preferably formatted as YYYY-MM-DD but may be sent as any common date format.

args.name: title
args.info: Return only issues in series whose title matches the input.

args.name: titleStartsWith
args.info: Return only issues in series whose title starts with the input.

args.name: startYear
args.info: Return only issues in series whose start year matches the input.

args.name: issueNumber
args.info: Return only issues in series whose issue number matches the input.

args.name: diamondCode
args.info: Filter by diamond code.

args.name: digitalId
args.info: Filter by digital comic id.

args.name: upc
args.info: Filter by UPC.

args.name: isbn
args.info: Filter by ISBN.

args.name: ean
args.info: Filter by EAN.

args.name: issn
args.info: Filter by ISSN.

args.name: hasDigitalIssue
args.info: Include only results which are available digitally.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only comics which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: creators
args.info: Return only comics which feature work by the specified creators (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: series
args.info: Return only comics which are part of the specified series (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: events
args.info: Return only comics which take place in the specified events (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: stories
args.info: Return only comics which contain the specified stories (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: sharedAppearances
args.info: Return only comics in which the specified characters appear together (for example in which BOTH Spider-Man and Wolverine appear).

args.name: collaborators
args.info: Return only comics in which the specified creators worked together (for example in which BOTH Stan Lee and Jack Kirby did work).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: focDate, onsaleDate, title, issueNumber, modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

blocks.name: getEventsByCharacter
blocks.description: Fetches lists of events containing a specific character, with optional filters.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: characterId
args.info: A single character id.

args.name: name
args.info: Filter the event list by name.

args.name: nameStartsWith
args.info: Return events with names that begin with the specified string (e.g. Sp).

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only events which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: creators
args.info: Return only comics which feature work by the specified creators (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: series
args.info: Return only events which are part of the specified series (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only events which take place in the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: stories
args.info: Return only events which contain the specified stories (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: name, startDate modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

blocks.name: getSeriesByCharacter
blocks.description: Fetches lists of series containing a specific character, with optional filters.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: characterId
args.info: A single character id.

args.name: title
args.info: Return only issues in series whose title matches the input.

args.name: titleStartsWith
args.info: Return only issues in series whose title starts with the input.

args.name: startYear
args.info: Return only issues in series whose start year matches the input.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only series which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: creators
args.info: Return only series which feature work by the specified creators (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only series which contain the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: events
args.info: Return only series which have comics that take place during the specified events (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: stories
args.info: Return only series which contain the specified stories (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: seriesType
args.info: Filter the series by publication frequency type. Values: collection, one shot, limited, ongoing

args.name: contains
args.info: Return only series containing one or more comics with the specified format. Values: comic, digital comic, hardcover, magazine, trade paperback, digest, graphic novel, infinite comic).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: title, startYear, modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

blocks.name: getCreatorsByComic
blocks.description: Fetches lists of comic creators whose work appears in a specific comic, with optional filters.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: comicId
args.info: A single comic id.

args.name: firstName
args.info: Filter by creator first name (e.g. brian).

args.name: middleName
args.info: Filter by creator middle name (e.g. Michael).

args.name: lastName
args.info: Filter by creator last name (e.g. Bendis).

args.name: suffix
args.info: Filter by suffix or honorific (e.g. Jr., Sr.).

args.name: nameStartsWith
args.info: Filter by creator names that match critera (e.g. B, St L).

args.name: firstNameStartsWith
args.info: Filter by creator first names that match critera (e.g. B, St L).

args.name: middleNameStartsWith
args.info: Filter by creator middle names that match critera (e.g. Mi).

args.name: lastNameStartsWith
args.info: Filter by creator last names that match critera (e.g. Ben).

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only creators which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: series
args.info: Return only creators who worked on in the specified series (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only creators who worked on in the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: stories
args.info: Return only creators who worked on in the specified stories (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: lastName, firstName, middleName, suffix, modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

args.info: Return only creators which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: events
args.info: Return only creators who worked on comics that took place in the specified events (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only creators who worked on in the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: series
args.info: Return only creators who worked on the specified series (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: lastName, firstName, middleName, suffix, modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

blocks.name: getEventsByStory
blocks.description: Fetches lists of events in which a specific story appears, with optional filters.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: storyId
args.info: A single story id.

args.name: name
args.info: Filter the event list by name.

args.name: nameStartsWith
args.info: Return events with names that begin with the specified string (e.g. Sp).

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only events which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: creators
args.info: Return only comics which feature work by the specified creators (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: characters
args.info: Return only events which feature the specified characters (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only events which take place in the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: series
args.info: Return only events which are part of the specified series (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: name, startDate modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.

blocks.name: getSeriesByStory
blocks.description: Fetches lists of comic series in which the specified story takes place.

args.name: publicKey
args.info: Public api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: privateKey
args.info: Private api key obtained from Marvel

args.name: storyId
args.info: A single story id.

args.name: title
args.info: Return only issues in series whose title matches the input.

args.name: titleStartsWith
args.info: Return only issues in series whose title starts with the input.

args.name: startYear
args.info: Return only issues in series whose start year matches the input.

args.name: modifiedSince
args.info: Return only series which have been modified since the specified date.

args.name: creators
args.info: Return only series which feature work by the specified creators (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: comics
args.info: Return only series which contain the specified comics (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: characters
args.info: Return only series which feature the specified characters (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: creators
args.info: Return only series which feature work by the specified creators (accepts an array of ids).

args.name: seriesType
args.info: Filter the series by publication frequency type. Values: collection, one shot, limited, ongoing

args.name: contains
args.info: Return only series containing one or more comics with the specified format. Values: comic, digital comic, hardcover, magazine, trade paperback, digest, graphic novel, infinite comic).

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order the result set by a field or fields. Add a "-" to the value sort in descending order. Multiple values are given priority in the order in which they are passed. Values: title, startYear, modified

args.name: limit
args.info: Limit the result set to the specified number of resources.

args.name: offset
args.info: Skip the specified number of resources in the result set.
